intro: Macclellandia, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plants typically grow in rocky or sandy soils and are well adapted to arid environments. Macclellandia species often have narrow, grass-like leaves and produce small, yellow to orange flowers. They are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging conditions.
